title: Hashim ibn Utba
text:
Hashim ibn Utba ibn Abi Waqqas (), was a <a href="Muslim">Muslim</a> <a href="army">army</a> <a href="commander">commander</a>. He was <a href="Sa%27d%20ibn%20Abi%20Waqqas">Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas</a> nephew through his father, and was a <a href="Companions%20of%20the%20Prophet">Companions of the Prophet</a> <a href="Muhammad">Muhammad</a>. Hāshim participated in the <a href="Ridda%20wars">Ridda wars</a> against the rebellious <a href="Arabic">Arabic</a> <a href="tribe">tribe</a>s following the death of Mohammad in order to return them to Islam. He fought the <a href="Byzantine%20Empire">Byzantines</a> in <a href="Battle%20of%20Yarmouk">Battle of Yarmouk</a> under the command of <a href="Khalid%20ibn%20al-Walid">Khalid ibn al-Walid</a>. He played a vital role in the <a href="Battle%20of%20al-Q%C4%81disiyyah">Battle of al-Qādisiyyah</a> that led to the conquest of <a href="Al-Mada%27in">Al-Mada'in</a> by Muslims. He died in <a href="Battle%20of%20Siffin">Battle of Siffin</a> fighting on the side of <a href="Ali">Ali</a>.
Biography.
Hashim ibn Utbah was born after Muhammad proclaimed his prophethood.
Hashim embraced Islam during the <a href="Conquest%20of%20Mecca">Conquest of Mecca</a>.
During the outbreak of the <a href="Ridda%20wars">Great apostate rebellions</a>, Hashim participated against the rebellious <a href="Arabic">Arabic</a> <a href="tribe">tribe</a>s following the death of Mohammad in order to return them to Islam.
Hashim participated in the <a href="Battle%20of%20the%20Yarmuk">Battle of the Yarmuk</a>. <a href="Ibn%20%27Abd%20al-Barr">Ibn 'Abd al-Barr</a> recorded the testimony that Hashim lost one of his eye during this battle,
<a href="Shia">Shia</a> historian <a href="Muhammad%20ibn%20Musa%20al-Khwarizmi">Ibn Musa al-Khwarizmi</a> reported Hashim was sent to Iraq and participated in the <a href="Battle%20of%20al-Qadisiyyah">Battle of al-Qadisiyyah</a>.
Hashim ibn Utbah were sent by <a href="Sa%27d%20ibn%20Abi%20Waqqas">Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas</a> to lead the army to the <a href="battle%20of%20Jalula">battle of Jalula</a>, where Hashim dispatched <a href="Jarir%20ibn%20Abdullah%20al-Bajali">Jarir ibn Abdullah al-Bajali</a> from <a href="Bajila">Bajila</a> tribe with a heavy force of cavalry to check the enemy position.
